channel.title: New Class: Kingsguard
channel.description:
The Kingsguard: Faction: Neutral, Support. Unique, Immune to Conversion Win Requirement: Ensure that the starting king survives until the end of the game. You do not need to be alive at the end. _Passives_: **Sworn Sword** - Immune to being occupied at night and immune to target changing. You know how many more uses the King has of their Guards! ability. **Redemption** - **_I currently am unable to think of a replacement for the old one, I especially want feedback on how the Kingsguard could redeem itself._** _Day Ability_ - **Convene Meeting** - At night you will be able to speak to the King. He will know your name.(2 uses) _Night Abilities_ - **Preside Over** - You will protect the King with your life tonight. If he is attacked the attacker will instead target you that night. You and the attacker both are dealt a lethal blow. This bypasses death immunity and redirection immunity. _(3 uses)_ **Inspiring Leader** - Tonight you rouse the spirits of the King's guards. The king gains one use of Guards! _(Two uses, but has a one day cool down)_
All feedback is welcome! Please write what you think about this.

item.title: New Class: Kingsguard
item.dc:creator: Alice
item.description:
orangeandblack5:

But the identity of the King is determined by RNG.

Correct. The issue here is that depending on the number of Kingsguards in the game then this would mean that there will be an additional one to four players locked into in either faction based on purely RNG alone. Allies mixed in with Convene Meeting essentially means that by the second day the Unseen/Cult can potentially have 3 players, 1 EK, along with 1~3 Kingsguards at their side, essentially turning the game into a 7 Scum v 8 Town v 1 NK with the possibility of putting the game past LyLo the first day depending on how the night kills go.

If the King is good and several Kingsguards spawn, this essentially means that the BD King cannot be killed at night which makes it impossible for scum to win.

In short, this class is stupidly swingy.
